TTPB: Yes, it is pathetic. The top universities such as CMU, MIT, or Stanford often send their results quickly whether there are COVID19 or not. The faculties in the universities often ask students completing their works as soon as possible. However, some of faculties do not complete their jobs as soon as possible.

(Ignore waitlist). In response to Jeff, this is a pathetic excuse. Assuming more people are admitted, Brown still has to â€œsellâ€ their program to get students to go. Waiting this long without any updates shows you are unorganized and/or donâ€™t care. Letâ€™s hope your faculty do research better than admissions... itâ€™s not that hard to send email updates to students. This applies for other schools too. Pathetic. With or without covid as an excuse

This is Jeff speaking as a CS faculty member not on the admissions committee, in response to comments below. We don't have a department-wide waitlist for PhD applications because after admissions committee review, individual faculty or groups can make decisions on PhD applicants, and some do it late. Most PhD decisions have been made, but there's a non-zero chance for someone to still be admitted now. Masters admissions is a different process and still very much ongoing, I'm not sure if decisions are ready yet. Thanks for your patience, and I don't check here regularly so won't be able to follow up.

email to check website

The Computer Science, PHD program at Brown University appreciates the opportunity to review
your materials. The program has carefully reviewed a deep and talented pool of applicants from
which we were only able to accept a limited number. I regret to inform you that your application
was not approved for admission to Brown University for Fall 2020.

We would like to convey our sincere thanks to you for your interest in graduate study at Brown. I
know from my own experience, as both an applicant and an advisor, the energy and time that it
takes to apply for graduate study. We understand that this is a challenging process, and our
decision should not be viewed as a negative evaluation of your experience and qualifications.

I wish you the best in your academic endeavors
FeelsBadMan.jpg

I got this ambiguous email from Brown, 2 months after having submitted the application. Does anyone else get the same email?

"Thank you for your application and interest in the PhD program in computer science at Brown University!
We are looking for new students across all branches of computer science. Our ties to other university departments provide strong opportunities for students to conduct interdisciplinary research. 
PhD students can expect to receive full tuition support, health insurance, and a generous stipend. Students receive on average USD $28,000 during the 9-month academic year, with many opportunities to supplement this at a higher rate in the summer. Students in good academic standing are guaranteed five years of full academic support. 

We have been actively reviewing applications and will be doing a rolling admission; we have started admitting students in the first wave.  Our visit days for admitted applicants will be March 12, March 13 and March 14, 2020.  If you are admitted, we will be in touch with more information about the visit.
If you have any questions, please contact us via cs-phd-info@brown.edu.
With our best regards,
The faculty in the Department of Computer Science"
